channel.title: Chemical Data Reporting
channel.description: Updated Chemical Data Reporting content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Federal Register Notice: Chemical Data Reporting; 2016 Submission Period Extension
item.description:
EPA is amending the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) Chemical Data Reporting (CDR) regulations by extending the submission deadline for 2016 reports from September 30, 2016 to October 31, 2016.

  • Federal Register Notice: Chemical Data Reporting; 2016 Submission Period Extension (PDF)(10 pp, 804 K, September, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell

item.title: Request for Full Exemption of Four Pulping Chemicals from the TSCA Chemical Data Reporting Rule Requirements
item.description:
• The American Forest & Paper Association (AFPA) petitioned for a full exemption from CDR reporting for the following four pulping chemicals:
    • Sulfite Liquors and Cooking Liquors, white (CAS No. 68131-33-9) (white liquor)
    • Sulfite Liquors and Cooking Liquors, spent (CAS No. 66071-92-9) (black liquor)
    • Sulfite Liquors and Cooking Liquors, spent, oxidized (CAS No. 68514-09-0) (black liquor, oxidized)
    • Sulfite Liquors and Cooking Liquors, green (CAS No. 68131-30-6) (green liquor).
  • Request for Full Exemption of Four Pulping Chemicals from the TSCA Chemical Data Reporting Rule Requirements (PDF)(20 pp, 2 MB, May 6, 2015)
  • EPA's Response to Exemption Request from the American Forest & Paper Association (AFPA) (PDF)(4 pp, 2 MB, July 13, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell

item.title: 2016 Chemical Data Reporting Frequent Questions
item.description:
These Frequent Questions (FQs) are intended to clarify the reporting requirements for Chemical Data Reporting for the 2016 reporting period.

  • 2016 Chemical Data Reporting Frequent Questions (PDF)(75 pp, 471 K, July 11, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell

item.title: Case Studies for the 2016 Chemical Data Reporting
item.description:
This document presents case studies to help you in reporting for 2016 Chemical Data Reporting (CDR). EPA designed these examples to illustrate reporting requirements published as part of the CDR Rule (published August 16, 2011), and to address general reporting issues from the 2012 CDR.

  • Case Studies for the 2016 Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(40 pp, 3 MB, June, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell

item.title: 2016 Chemical Data Reporting Requirements & eCDRweb Reporting Tool
item.description:
The Powerpoint presentation of the May 4, 2016 CDR Requirements & eCDRweb Reporting Tool.

item.title: TSCA Chemical Data Reporting Fact Sheet: Reporting Manufactured Chemical Substances from Metal Mining and Related Activities
item.description:
This fact sheet provides guidance on the Chemical Data Reporting (CDR) rule requirements related to the reporting of mined metals, intermediates, and byproducts manufactured during metal mining and related activities.

  • TSCA Chemical Data Reporting Fact Sheet: Reporting Manufactured Chemical Substances from Metal Mining and Related Activities (PDF)(16 pp, 211 K, May 13, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell

item.title: TSCA Chemical Data Reporting - Chemical substances for which information is not required
item.description:
Chemical substances that are partially exempt from reporting requirements under the CDR rule in 2016 are listed in 40 CFR 711.6(b)(1) and 711.6(b)(2). Below is the June 1, 2016 version of 40 CFR 711.6 for your convenience.

  • Title 40, Part 711, §711.6 - Chemical substances for which information is not required (PDF)(13 pp, 227 K, June, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell

item.title: 2016 Chemical Data Reporting Training Modules
item.description:
The following seven training modules were developed to assist those who may be required to submit reports in 2016 in response to the Chemical Data Reporting (CDR) under TSCA. Providing an overview of the reporting requirements for the 2016 CDR, the training modules were designed to be viewed either in order or separately and will help in understanding how to register with Central Data Exchange (CDX) and complete Form U. Special topics include information about joint submissions and byproduct chemical substances.

Modules

  • Module 1 – New Requirements for 2016 Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(8 pp, 2 MB, May, 2016)
  • Module 2 - Reporting Requirements for the 2016 Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(31 pp, 5 MB, May, 2016)
  • Module 3 - Completing Form U for 2016 Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(37 pp, 3 MB, May, 2016)
  • Module 4 - Registering with CDX for Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(18 pp, 1 MB, May, 2016)
  • Module 5 - Using the eCDRweb Reporting Tool (PDF)(17 pp, 1 MB, May, 2016)
  • Module 6 - Joint Submissions for Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(15 pp, 2 MB, May, 2016)
  • Module 7 – Byproducts and Chemical Data Reporting (PDF)(31 pp, 4 MB, May, 2016)
item.dc:creator: kboswell
